On 11/29/05, Matt Garland <mgvelvet@...> wrote:
> Given that:
> 1. th=
e server recently claimed that this resource analyzes portfolios
> 2. the s=
erver returns an application/portfolio-analysis when I submit
> an applicat=
ion/portfolio to this resource
>
> Can I assume that the portfolio analysis=
 is for the submitted portfolio?

AIUI, no, you can't assume that, you have=
 to be told about it.  For
example, if the portfolio representation provide=
d a URI for that
portfolio which the returned analysis referenced, then you=
'd know it. 
The association between request and response representations h=
as to be
made by the representations, not by the protocol.

> I think Mark =
is suggesting that I cannot make that assumption, but I
> don't understand =
precisely why not, and thus I don't know what
> additional work I would nee=
d to do to correctly correlate the
> portfolio-analysis with the portfolio.=


There ya go ...

Mark.
